hackathon-description-text: THacks 2 is Toronto's premier hackathon for learning, building and innovation. Held at the University of Toronto's Sandford Fleming Building and Galbraith Building, the event features a jam-packed, 24-hour lineup of workshops, speakers and competition. At the end of weekend, teams of hackers will pitch their projects and compete for incredible prizes. With food, friends, and fun (did we mention free entry?) - THacks 2 is the hackathon you won't want to miss!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1000 cash prize + 4 Hack the North 2018 Tickets + 4 Muse Headbands + 4 $500 Indico credits + 4 EZ Mugs + 4 Brain Power Certificates
$500 cash prize + 4 Hack the North 2018 Tickets + 4 $250 Indico credits + 2 EZ mugs + 4 Brain Power Certificates + Cases of Soylent
$250 cash prize + 4 Hack the North 2018 Tickets + 4 $100 Indico credits + 1 EZ Mug + 4 Brain Power Certificates
4 bottles of Liovena organic essential oil & a hand soap
Google Pixel XL 2 + Google Daydream +  Pixelbuds (provided by dHack)

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: House of VR's Best AR/VR Hack

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: RBC presents the #FutureMaker's Award for the Most Innovative Solution!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: RBC's #FutureMaker's Award for the Most Innovative Solution

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=10 King's College Rd, Toronto, ON M5S 3G8, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the hack successfully solve a problem? Is the hack convenient to operate?
How original and unique is the hack? Is the hack innovative, or does it at least provide a new approach for existing problems?
Does the hack have a certain extent of technical complexity? Does the team overcome some technical challenges? Can all parts of the program work together correctly?
Is the user interface clean and attractive?  Does the hack provide a seamless user experience?
Does the team explain their targeting problem and their solution in a clear manner？
